title: What's the reasoning behind the new 175-200 AA range for melee champions
body:
Most melee champs have 125 AA range whether the model is small like Akali or big like Alistar, however:
Tahm 200, as well as the expected reworks: Garen 125>175, Darius 125>175 and Morde 125>200. Why are new melees getting such a higher AA range? I don't think it's fair to other melee champions that have also been stuck with 125 AA range for years like these guys.

replies.body: Historically we've almost always used 125 range for melee champs, with a few exceptions. When working on the juggernaut changes however we came to feel that range of of melee attacks was a lever it would be appropriate to vary more. Slightly increased attack range on immobile melee characters allows us to give them a little bit of extra target access without having to give them additional mobility or CC tools. Highly mobile champions by contrast we feel should often have to take the risk of getting right up to their targets to AA as part of the price they pay for that mobility.

Why won't Skarner get increased melee range, then? He's as immobile as Garen.

EDIT: 
> "Highly mobile champions by contrast we feel should often have to take the risk of getting right up to their targets to AA as part of the price they pay for that mobility."

How do you guys feel about Riven, one of the most mobile champions in the game, being able to get 200 AA range on-demand? It kind of negates the entire "pay a price for mobility" thing.

Garen, Mordekaiser and Darius all have huge weapons to help justify increasing their attack range.  

It's probably harder to justify it when Skarner is hitting them with his claws.
Couldn't have said it better myself, you stopped me from swearing at that guy^

True, but you could make the claws larger in a small VU for Skarner to get around that issue. I don't think "model!" is a very compelling argument on why x does get it and y won't. I'm not even saying Skarner should get increased AA range, but I'm curious about the distinction being made here for Garen and Skarner.
Why J4 has 175 range then? I don't think it makes much sense with that explanation since he's pretty mobile ^^
Give Shen bigger swords! Give him 150 AA like Yas and Diana.

I would say so. Think about how much 50 range can mean in the bot lane and then apply it to melee. Garen and co can get in range to auto you quicker than you can (if you're also melee, but have the standard range) and if you turn to end the trade, they can get in another auto on you a lot easier than you can to them should they turn.

It is the sort of change that can turn neutral matchups into favourable ones very easily, I wouldn't call it a slight buff honestly.
